title.narrative: IR 4.4 COMMUNICATION POUR DEVELOPPEMENT

description.narrative: Intermediate Results (IR) 4.4: By the end of 2018, in a favorable social environment, families and communities in targeted intervention areas, adopt essential family practices and promote individual and collective changes necessary for the survival, development and protection of children., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Early Childhood Development, Immunization, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Polio Eradication. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: CHILDREN RIGHTS ENABLING ENVIRONMENTPCR4 : By the end of 2018, laws, social policies, planning, budgets, expenditures, public opinion and social norms are informed by ongoing analysis of the situation of children, monitoring and evaluation and promote an environment conducive to the full-implementation of children's rights

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 4.4: By the end of 2018, in a favorable social environment, families and communities in targeted intervention areas, adoptessential family practices and promote individual and collective changes necessary for the survival, development and protection ofchildren.

description.narrative: In 2019, 3,266 additional Community participation committees (CACs) were created under the Ebola response, bringing the total number of established CACs over the past 4 years to 56,890. Through these CACs and trainings of health workers, community radios, religious groups, an estimated 36 million people have been reached with information on key family practices, routine immunization, exclusive breastfeeding, hand washing, diarrhea treatment, use of insecticide-treated mosquito nets, birth registration, community-based monitoring of children's enrolment and retention in school, and Ebola prevention. | Status:Met | As-of Date:08/02/2020
